court: IN THE HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB & HARYAN AT CHANDIGARH RFA No.2093 of 1991 Date of decision: February 7,2007 Union of India and another V.Sher Singh and another CORAM: HON'BLE MR.JUSTICE VINEY MITTAL Present: Ms.Daya Chaudhary, Assistant Solicitor General of India for Union of India. Viney Mittal,J.(Oral) This order shall dispose of a batch of appeals. Learned counsel appearing for appellant,Union of India,informs the court that the controversy in the present appeals pertains to only the assessment of super-structure and standing trees. Learned counsel further informs the court that in a connected matter, arising out of the same acquisition proceedings ( Union of India and others V. Hari Singh), an appeal was filed which was time barred and a C.M. No.1082-C1 of 1992 was filed for condonation of delay. A learned singal Judge of this court, vide order dated February 13,1992, while rejecting the prayer for condonation of delay also upheld the assessment made by the reference Court with regard to compensation for super-structure. In these circumstances, learned counsel states that the present appeals are also liable to be dismissed. Ordered accordingly. February 7,2007 ( Viney Mittal ) sks Judge
